poem:
**Growth on Paper**

In the whisper of numbers,  
a breath—a mere 0.1—  
slips through fingers  
as coins tumble,  
a dance of shadows  
across ledgers,  
while cupboards echo,  
hollow as a chord,   
in homes where light   
still counts the cost.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK recession fears ease as economy returns to growth, but living standards fall – business live 10.53am GMT Here’s a clip of Rachel Reeves discussing today’s GDP report: 'I am still not satisfied with the level of growth that our economy is achieving'Chancellor Rachel Reeves reacts to the UK economy growing 0.1% in the final quarter of 2024 ⬇️https://t.co/OC1dJhvQ9I📺 Sky 501, Virgin 602, Freeview 233 and YouTube pic.twitter.com/aSZvFZtPc2— Sky News (@SkyNews) February 13, 2025 10.39am". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
